009package com.weather.sdk.model;
010
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
013import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
014import java.util.Objects;
015
016/**
017 * Represents the weather conditions (main category and detailed description).
018 *
019 * <p>This class encapsulates the weather information from the OpenWeatherAPI response, providing
020 * the primary weather category (e.g., "Clear", "Rain", "Clouds") and a detailed description (e.g.,
021 * "clear sky", "light rain").
022 *
023 * <h2>Weather Categories</h2>
024 *
025 * <p>OpenWeatherAPI uses standard weather condition codes:
026 *
027 * <ul>
028 *   <li>Clear - Clear sky
029 *   <li>Clouds - Various cloud conditions
030 *   <li>Rain - Various rain conditions
031 *   <li>Drizzle - Light rain
032 *   <li>Thunderstorm - Storm conditions
033 *   <li>Snow - Snow conditions
034 *   <li>Mist - Visibility issues due to particles
035 *   <li>Fog - Thick fog conditions
036 *   <li>Haze - Hazy conditions
037 *   <li>Dust - Dust in the air
038 *   <li>Sand - Sand conditions
039 *   <li>Ash - Volcanic ash
040 *   <li>Squall - Strong wind gusts
041 *   <li>Tornado - Tornado conditions
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h2>JSON Mapping</h2>
045 *
046 * <p>Mapped from OpenWeatherAPI response:
047 *
048 * <pre>
049 * {
050 *   "weather": {
051 *     "main": "Clear",
052 *     "description": "clear sky"
053 *   }
054 * }
055 * </pre>
056 *
057 * @since 1.0.0
058 */
059@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
060public final class Weather {
061
062  /** The main weather category (e.g., "Clear", "Rain", "Clouds"). */
063  @JsonProperty("main")
064  private final String main;
065
066  /** The detailed weather description (e.g., "clear sky", "light rain"). */
067  @JsonProperty("description")
068  private final String description;
069
070  /**
071   * Constructs a new Weather instance.
072   *
073   * @param main the main weather category. Must not be null or empty.
074   * @param description the detailed weather description. Must not be null or empty.
075   * @throws NullPointerException if either parameter is null
076   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if either parameter is empty
077   */
078  @JsonCreator
079  public Weather(
080      @JsonProperty("main") final String main,
081      @JsonProperty("description") final String description) {
082    this.main = Objects.requireNonNull(main, "Main weather category must not be null");
083    this.description = Objects.requireNonNull(description, "Weather description must not be null");
084
085    if (main.isBlank()) {
086      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Main weather category must not be empty");
087    }
088    if (description.isBlank()) {
089      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Weather description must not be empty");
090    }
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Returns the main weather category.
095   *
096   * @return the main weather category (e.g., "Clear", "Rain", "Clouds"). Never returns null.
097   */
098  public String getMain() {
099    return main;
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Returns the detailed weather description.
104   *
105   * @return the detailed weather description (e.g., "clear sky", "light rain"). Never returns null.
106   */
107  public String getDescription() {
108    return description;
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Indicates whether this weather represents clear conditions.
113   *
114   * @return true if the main category is "Clear", false otherwise
115   */
116  public boolean isClear() {
117    return "Clear".equalsIgnoreCase(main);
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Indicates whether this weather represents precipitation (rain, snow, drizzle, etc.).
122   *
123   * @return true if the weather involves precipitation, false otherwise
124   */
125  public boolean isPrecipitation() {
126    return "Rain".equalsIgnoreCase(main)
127        || "Drizzle".equalsIgnoreCase(main)
128        || "Snow".equalsIgnoreCase(main);
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Indicates whether this weather represents severe conditions.
133   *
134   * @return true if the weather is considered severe (thunderstorm, tornado, etc.), false otherwise
135   */
136  public boolean isSevere() {
137    return "Thunderstorm".equalsIgnoreCase(main)
138        || "Tornado".equalsIgnoreCase(main)
139        || "Squall".equalsIgnoreCase(main);
140  }
141
142  /**
143   * Returns a human-readable summary of the weather conditions.
144   *
145   * @return a formatted weather summary
146   */
147  public String getSummary() {
148    return main + ": " + description;
149  }
150
151  @Override
152  public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
153    final boolean result;
154    if (this == obj) {
155      result = true;
156    } else if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
157      result = false;
158    } else {
159      final Weather weather = (Weather) obj;
160      result =
161          Objects.equals(main, weather.main) && Objects.equals(description, weather.description);
162    }
163    return result;
164  }
165
166  @Override
167  public int hashCode() {
168    return Objects.hash(main, description);
169  }
170
171  @Override
172  public String toString() {
173    return "Weather{main='" + main + "', description='" + description + "'}";
174  }
175}
